chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Craig Merath was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Until 9/30/2018 per statue 973.09(2)(ar),   May be transferred to Racine County.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No contact with victim in criminal complaint in any way, shape, form or by 3rd party.
Allow Agent access to any and all electronic or digital devices.
Defendant to strictly follow rules in case 14CV1918.
DNA previously done and waived by the court.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event:  for the October 22, 2015 Sentencing Hearing filed by Erin Furgason.

Defendant Steven Craig Merath in court.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim makes statements.  State makes recommendations.  Defendant makes statements.
The Court Orders the Following:
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
90 Days Jail with out Huber (Credit - 0 days).  
Term of Probation: until 9/30/2018 per statue 973.09 (2)(ar), maybe transferred to Racine County
Conditions of Probation:
Allow agent access to any and all electronic or digital devices;
No contact with victim in criminal complaint in any way, shape, form, or by 3rd party;
Defendant to strickly follow rules in case #14CV1918;
COSTS:  $243.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA previously done and waived by the court.

Defendant Steven Craig Merath in court.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads no contest to count # 1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Defendant makes statements.  State advises the victim wishes to speak at sentencing.  Victim has not been notified.  Court sets this case for a sentencing hearing.  

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Steven Craig Merath in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 09:00 am.
